subject: Data
title: William Playfair Invents the Bar Chart
description: One-minute skill: William Playfair Invents the Bar Chart.

hook.text: In 1786, a Scottish engineer got tired of reading trade data in tables. So he drew rectangles instead.

buildup.text: William Playfair invented the bar chart, line chart, and pie chart â€” all within a few years.

discovery.text: His bar charts compared imports and exports visually, making economic trends obvious at a glance.

twist.text: Statisticians dismissed his charts as unscientific. They preferred raw numbers over pictures.

climax.text: Playfair's inventions are now the most widely used chart types in the world.

punchline.text: One man invented three chart types we all use daily.

quiz.question: Who invented the bar chart, line chart, and pie chart?
